content.description: This route starts left of Nemesis in the often times wet and or dirty crack.  Once you've gained a ledge, follow the crack to a 2 bolt anchor.
Start under the roof next to the left facing slab, go up the slab to under the roof, feel in the corner for a small crimp, and continue out over the roof, then up the arete to the tree at the top.

The Nose is the rightmost route on the wall. Just before you get to the walk-through crevice to the main wall. This route starts on the outside of the arete and wraps around it to the chains just on the inside, right of the arete. The crevice can be chimneyed on TR after leading this route.
content.location: The arete on the left side of the opening of the crevice.

content.description:
From the Vgroove, step R at the 1st bolt to gain the jug on the arete. 2x more bolts to reach Memento Mori at the big ledge. Good introduction to the overhanging pump.. Extend the 3rd bolt with 2 quickdraws to avoid rope drag.

(Its a bit to the R as the original start came in from the route to the R)
start as for King of Fives, cutting R along the ledge at the 2nd bolt to finish up the obvious bulging crack system above. Extend the 3rd to prevent rope drag.
content.protection:
7x fixe 3.5" A7 glueins, anchor - 2x gluein 1/2inch

see note on anchors

mountainproject.com/v/burne…

content.description:
Start in a V groove 2m R of Cheeky and climb the open book corner until a short crack system leads to the top.  anchor 2x 1/2" gluein

see note on anchors:

mountainproject.com/v/burne…

Climb the detached pillar left of Cheeky Bastard, then traverse right to the top of Cheeky Bastard. The climbing is easy with a short, well protected crux. EDIT: Steve Weyand reports there is now a two-bolt anchor, which CrimperE6 subsequently removed.
content.protection: 1 set of cams up to 4". Take long slings to set up an anchor at the top or to protect the downclimbing traverse to the anchor of Cheeky Bastard.
content.location: Starts at base of the small detached pillar about 20 feet left of Cheeky Bastard.

content.description: This route is right of Nemesis. The crux is immediately after clipping the second-to-last bolt. Follow the finger flake/limestone rail, by using layback technique and smearing with some face moves on small edges.
content.protection:
4 3/8" newer bolts with a 2 bolt anchor and chains.

Highly recommended to stick clip the 1st bolt to avoid a long fall into the pit that guards the bottom of the route. Giving it a PG13 rating without stick clipping the first bolt.
content.location: This route is located between Nemesis and Figure Four.  Lower off chains at the anchor.

content.description:
Good bolts at good stances to the top, not too bad to learn to lead on if you stick clip the first bolt (my first lead climb). I'll even stick clip the first bolt sometimes since it's probably the "hardest" clip and has a gnarly (ie ankle breaking) landing/ gulley if you don't get it.

There is a crack on the rightish side of the route that can either be really useful if it's dry, if it's wet it's still useable but can be a pain. It's easier on the last bolt to the chains to just go to the right/ strait to the chains and avoid the grassy ledge.
content.protection: 4 good bolts to the chains up top.
content.location: Is the next route to the left of the Arete climb (ie 2nd over from farthest right climb). The top has a little grassy ledge to the left of the chains.

content.description:
update* No yellow jackets on the route anymore per the beta down in the comments.

There is a crevice that makes a bomber undercling in the rock that as of November 2012 some yellow jackets have taken up residence. If you climb before their nest warms up it's ok. Or maybe the winter will take them out.
content.location: The obvious series of bolts on the slab to the left of Nemesis (the arete).

content.description: Utilizing nice side pulls and edges pull onto the face below the 1st bolt, then move right to get established on the slab. Continue up the steepening slab through some very nice pockets to a position below a bulge. Pull the bulge using side pulls and small edges to holds on a sharp flake and the anchors.
content.location: On the left edge of the slab, left of Cheeky Bastard.

content.description: Begin this route in the crack just right of Figure Four. Climb delicate, yet easier moves to the 3rd bolt, then get ready for thin and difficult movements as you step right toward the undercling. The crux is the sharp and thin features that guard the 4th bolt.
content.protection:
ROUTE-

Equipped with 4- 3" X 3/8" Powers 5 Piece bolts with Fixe hangers.

ANCHOR-

2- 3/8" X 3 1/2" Powers 5 piece bolts with Fixe hangers, with plated chain and quick links.

TR ACCESS-

1- 3/8 X 3 1/2" Powers 5 piece bolt for TR access.
content.location: Route is located between Figure Four and The Nose
